title: Delete a TikTok account Webhook configuration

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: ID of your developer application. You can find the App ID by navigating to My Apps > App Detail > Basic Information .

parameters.name: secret
parameters.description: Secret of your developer application. You can find the Secret by navigating to My Apps > App Detail > Basic Information .

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The type of Webhook event configuration that you want to delete. Enum values: VIDEO : Post publishing events, which provide you with real-time updates on the status of content published via specific TikTok API endpoints. To learn more about the schema and sample payload of the events within this event category, see Post publishing events . COMMENT : comment update event, including the event comment.update . To learn more about the schema and sample payload of the event within this event category, see Comment update event .

parameters.name: item_list
parameters.description: Valid only when event_type is COMMENT . The IDs of the specific TikTok posts that you no longer want to receive comment update event notifications for. Max size: 100. To obtain the IDs of TikTok posts specified for an existing comment update Webhook configuration, use /business/webhook/list/ . If event_type is set to COMMENT and this field is provided, you will no longer receive notification of comment.update events for the specified posts under the TikTok account or TikTok accounts that authorized the developer app ( app_id ). If event_type is set to COMMENT and this field is not provided, you will no longer receive notification of comment.update events for all posts under the TikTok account or TikTok accounts that authorized the developer app ( app_id ).

examples.title: Delete an existing post publishing event Webhook configuration
Delete specific TikTok posts from an existing comment update event Webhook configuration
